reviewText: Wow. Just wow. All of these four, five star reviews for this lame piece of trash. Are we talking about the same film here? This is one pathetic excuse of an alleged comedy. The first movie was bad, but at least it had some semblence of a "popcorn film". This is just awful. Sorta like they took the outtakes, threw them up in the air, picked them up when they landed and assembled it together. I mean really, how can anyone actually like this?
summary: One of the worst movies ever made!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: i'm looking at the reviews @ amazon: did i see 5 stars for an incredibly BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD comedy?  a comedy?  well, i didn't laugh once.  it's like viewing a live action tom and jerry/road runner cartoon but it's  not---funny.  the bloopers at the end credits aren't worth chuckling. they  looked forced.  the bloopers in the 1st CANNONBALL were a hoot.  no need to  mention the all star cast here---all wasted.  ok, i did laugh once when the  pathetic charles nelson reilly (as the mobster Don Don) gets thrown thru a  wall by telly savalas and his bald headed cronies.
summary: 1 OF THE WORST MOVIES OF THE 20TH CENTURY
Title: N/A

reviewText: I echo the most recent review before this one--one of the worst movies ever made! Unlike the previous reviewer, I in fact love the first Cannonball Run movie. Sure, not the one of the greatest movies ever, but at least the first Cannonball was funny and had a certain charm to it. The sequel? Gag! Not funny at all, the writing is horrible, the scenes are haphazard and disonnected--an umitigated disaster. An amazing lineup of actors, but I'm sure most of them will hang their head in shame when anyone reminds them that they were a part of this movie. Some of the lesser-level actors whose acting ability was never stellar turn in some of the worst acting ever in this movie. Even the bloopers during the end credits aren't funny, although in the first movie they were. The first movie end credits' bloopers gave me the impression that the stars of the first Cannonball had a blast making the first movie, but I'm sure they were embarassed about the sequel. NOT RECOMMENDED.

reviewText: Alright folks, come clean. I know there are secret fans out there of this ridiculous mess that killed the popularity of Burt Reynolds, despite the fact that it was, improbably, a hit. Unfunny and overlong, it still remains  a mystery as to why watching all these big stars make fools of themselves  is a pleasure. At that price, why not add it to your DVD collection?

reviewText: I enjoyed the original Cannonball Run, but this film should never had been made. It should have been torpedoed in the planning stages. There was very little that was enjoyable about this bomb. I enjoyed the Tim Conway and Don Knotts cameos, but that's about it. Even the angry ape wasn't funny especially after the news of the ape that horribly attacked that woman a few years ago. Take my advice and skip it.

reviewText: Cannonball Run was not a movie sceaming for a sequel, but here it is for better or worse. reviewText: burt and friends are back again,and i want to know why! i was given these two movies by a coworker andwhile i thank him for the gift,i don't have the heart to tell him what a piece of junk these two movies are.the "PLOT" such as it is,burt and friends drive fast,fight, drink,drive fast somemore,wreck some cars,and thats it! the race comes at the end as a cartoon, i kid you not. the much talked about frank santara scenes were shot withy frank only and then cut into the movie,and it shows badly.not one laugh or even chuckle to be found in this mess.the large list of "guest stars" looks great till you notice that these same stars were on love boat every other week till it was droped from the line up.movies like this is what sent burt into a tailspin in the 80's.
summary: who asked for this trash as a sequel

reviewText: I love these cannonball movies. They sure don't make them like this anymore. Stunt man turned director Hal Needham (Smokey & The Bandit) has done just as an amazing job of casting this movie as he did with the first. Returning from the first CB movie is Burt Reynolds as J.J McClure and Dom DeLuise as Victor with the alter ego of Captain Chaos. Just by reading who is cast in this movie is unbelievable...- Burt Reynolds (Smokey and the bandit)- Dom DeLuise (Many Mel Brooks films)- Frank Sinatra (Rat Pack)- Dean Martin (Rat Pack)- Sammy Davis. Jr. (Rat Pack)- Jamie Far (Clinger/M*A*S*H)- Marilu Henner (Taxi)- Telly Savalas (The Dirty Dozen)- Susan Bach (Daisy/Dukes Of Hazzard)- Jackie Chan (Shakespeare in love)- Shirley MacLaine (Around the world in 80 days)- Tony Danza (Who's the boss)- Jim Nabors (Gomer Pile)- The guy who played Jaws in the Bond films... and many, many moreThe movie is great, just as great as the first one. Some people will dismiss it because they don't like to watch a great cast of actors having fun. Or they're too focused on their favourite actor who is not the star of this film. For me, it's a classic, one of the best sequels ever made and a 4 star movie in my book.However, where there is good praise at first comes the bad news. Unlike the first DVD for Cannonball run, this one has been totally ignored by Warner. There is nothing about this DVD that makes it stand out or make it worth replacing that old VHS copy. The quality is not really good; it has speckles in many places, noticeable ones. The sound is a bit shoddy now and then. There is no bonus features, no nothing: Just the movie. Not even subtitles where included. There is nothing at all but a menu with a picture of the image on the cover, and 2 options to play the movie or select a scene: Not even a trailer.I love this movie, so I had to get it no matter what it had included with it. But for those of you who like a good reason to buy a DVD `cause of some nice bonus goodies, then this one will leave you sore. They could have at least got Hal to do a commentary track like the first one. And the deleted scene Hal talks about on the 1st movies commentary of Burt and Shirley's heart warming special scene they wanted to do.If you like the movie, you might be a bit disappointed in the shoddy VHS looking image quality, lack of bonus features, And in full screen only. Still, it's at a good enough price for it to not matter.
summary: Great Movie.... Not Great DVD Transfer

reviewText: ....I like this movie better than the first film. The first Cannonball Run was just stupid and totally not funny. I believe both the pansy performance of Dom Deluise and the stupid performance of Roger Moore as a mentally fantasizing "Wacko" of a secret agent just made that movie that much more stupid.But, Cannonball Run II was pretty funny, at least, until you get to the Frank Sinatra part. After that, it just got more stupid.  Having Burt Reynolds, Dom Deluise, and Sammy Davis, Jr. dressing as barroom dancers was just stupid. I thought that Frank Sinatra would expect a more dignified role than what he's done here.But, anyway, it was better than the first Cannonball Run. If this one came out as Blu-Ray, I'd probably pay about eight dollars for it. Sure, why not?
summary: Forgive me for saying this but....
Title: N/A

reviewText: Justly forgotten, "Cannonball Run II" (1984) is a glorified home movie that displays its all-star cast in a spectacularly poor light. Production values are nonexistent and the anticipated Rat Pack reunion (with Frank Sinatra barely showing up) falls woefully flat. After sinking to the depths of "Stroker Ace," Burt Reynolds and director Hal Needham end their screen partnership on a wretched note. Sad to say, Dean Martin's last film appearance.

reviewText: Hey guys,If you know anything about this film, you'll know well enough to stay away.  Yes, this film is below garbage, but again, I never thought I'd witness another film by (former stunt-driver/director) Hal Needham,  Mr. Needham has a fresh approach this time, a bold approach - place the characters in the center of the frame, get acceptable lighting, place them in focus.  Nothing to it.  Well, there IS something to it.  And it's called a Real Movie'. This film is flat out garbage.  It's almost an Anti-Movie, those Hollywood pirates involved went out of their way to make a film that is flat, simple and just darn stupid.  Which is why I bought a copy.  Nobody - but NOBODY - makes films like this anymore.  Our current studio system may hire once-talented acting folk like Ben Affleck, Leo DiCaprio, Wynona Ryder, etc., the lot, whatever.  But never have we seen such a concentrated potion of ex-stars like 'Cannonball Run 2'.  But we get our shot - Burt Reynolds, Sammy Davis, Dean Martin, Abe Vigoda, Telly Savalis, Marilu Henner, Jim 'Gomer Pyle' Nabors, Don Knotts, Charles Nelson Reilly, that big klutz who played 'Jaws' in 2 James Bond films, even Jackie Chan, who later found some worthwhile projects to latch onto.  There are many other has-been appearences, but they merge in the film.  A film which is flat-out garbage, but a film that is so bad I own.  Again, I own it, but one question remains:  just how much cocaine was on the set?  The reason I ask?  This is a movie without a purpose, a plot, a soul, a reason for being.  So, drugs HAVE to be the explanation....  Did I mention that this film has to be seen to be believed?  Well, you already know the answer.  And if you don't - enjoy the film. In any strange way that you can....PS:  There are some really fast cars.
summary: 1 star is too much credit for a film like this....
Title: N/A
